scenarioDescription:
The OGLE-2017-BLG-0604L Exoplanetary System


Overview

OGLE-2017-BLG-0604L is a star with 0.7 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 12883.16 light years away from the solar system.

OGLE-2017-BLG-0604L is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the OGLE-2017-BLG-0604L system


OGLE-2017-BLG-0604L b

OGLE-2017-BLG-0604L b was discovered by the OGLE observatory, in 2020-10, using the microlensing method. Its semi-major axis is 4.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of OGLE-2017-BLG-0604L b is 162.180 times the mass of Earth. The radius of OGLE-2017-BLG-0604L b is 14.200 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, OGLE-2017-BLG-0604L b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system OGLE-2017-BLG-0604L, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the OGLE.
name: OGLE-2017-BLG-0604L - System With 1 Exoplanet
